comment.author: 22948027@N02
comment._content: The text in Norwegian reads "Tønsberg Hvalfangeri's Station 1916 - oct fra S.S.O". The latter part means "October - from South South-east". Tönsberg Hvalfangeri - a Norwegian Company - was established October 1, 1907, and got a lease from the British magistrate in Port Stanley for a whaling station in Stromnes Bay, South Georgia. They called the spot "Husvik harbour" after a small place just outside Tønsberg in Norway. At first , the company processed the whaling catch on floating factories, but in the season 1909-1910 a land station was erected, to be ready for the 1910-1911 season. From Tönnesen-Johnsen "The History of Modern Whaling" 1982, p 183. See also Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Husvik_Harbour The photographer is indicated by the text in the lower right hand corner "Efter Hans Torgersen's foto" - 'from Hans Torgersen's photographs'. Presumably this is a first page in an album, and the photographer's name for the whole album is thus known, for your records,

comment.author: 22948027@N02
